intro: Syngonanthus huberi, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 15-30 cm and thrives in well-drained soil with bright, indirect light. Syngonanthus huberi is popular as a houseplant due to its ability to bloom year-round under proper care. Its foliage is often velvety and comes in various shades of green, making it both ornamental and easy to maintain.
